result.execSummary:
The defendant Theresa S Nolden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Misdemeanor Conviction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
As to both counts:
*Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges, including DNA by 8/29/16 or, if not paid, entry of a civil judgment.
*Due to financial hardship, Court waived the domestic abuse assessments as to counts 2 & 3.
*Defendant may qualify to have the DNA sample expunged if she meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
Consecutive to: To any other sentence.
*Due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.

charges.descr: Intentionally Contact - Order for Misdemeanor Conviction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theresa S Nolden

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for zero days time served.  
AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, concurrent with count 2 with credit for zero days time served.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges, including DNA by 8/29/16 or, if not paid, entry of a civil judgment.
Due to financial hardship, Court waived the domestic abuse assessments as to counts 2 & 3.
Court advised the defendant that she may qualify to have the DNA sample expunged if she meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
Received and filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief.  
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Theresa S Nolden in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Theresa S Nolden in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to the case for the purposes of sentencing.
AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Theresa S Nolden not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea hearing, however, court unable to hear this case today. Court ordered case adjourned in branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-21-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Theresa S Nolden not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant on VOP hold.
Defense counsel requests brief adjournment to review plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Theresa S Nolden not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Jovan N; Chanel H; Susie L.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Theresa S Nolden in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Theresa S Nolden in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
